flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
This project is in 5 parts: cabinet, controller, computer, OS, and games.

The cabinet is plywood with carriage bolts. It costs $90 to build, and requires no equipment beyond a handsaw and a drill.

The controller is arcade buttons embedded in either Plexiglas or plywood, connected to a USB keyboard. No soldering, just tape. It costs $40-$80.

The computer is an Intel Atom motherboard, speakers and a power supply. It boots from a USB thumb drive, so no moving parts. You could use different hardware, but we're building from scratch. $200.

The OS is Ubuntu 10.10, with a few tweaks. It's free.

The games could just be MAME, but I'm using the system to show my Flash games in public, like in festivals, galleries, or bars. The system can support HTML5, Javascript, custom games, or Flash. I provide open-source sample projects.

guide.summary:
This project describes how to make an arcade console from scratch. 

You need have no special skills in engineering, electronics, or woodworking. No tools other than hand tools are required.
